Hit Points.Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d8 (or 5) + your Constitution modifier per cleric level after 1st

Proficiencies.Skills: Choose two from History, Insight, Medicine, Persuasion, and Religion

Starting Equipment.Weapon: a mace or a warhammer (if proficient)
Starting Equipment.Armor: scale mail, leather armor, or chain mail (if proficient)
Starting Equipment.Additional Weapon: a light crossbow and 20 bolts or any simple weapon
Starting Equipment.Pack: a priest's pack or an explorer's pack
Starting Equipment.Other: A shield and a holy symbol

Cantrips.Description: At 1st level, you know three cantrips of your choice from the cleric spell list. You learn additional cleric cantrips of your choice at higher levels.

Spell Slots.Description: The Cleric table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your cleric spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.

Spells Known.Description: You prepare the list of cleric spells that are available for you to cast, choosing from the cleric spell list. When you do so, choose a number of cleric spells equal to your Wisdom modifier + your cleric level (minimum of one spell).
Spells Known.Preparation: You can change your list of prepared spells when you finish a long rest.

Spellcasting Ability.Description: Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your cleric spells. The power of your spells comes from your devotion to your deity.
Spellcasting Ability.Spell Save DC: 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier
Spellcasting Ability.Spell Attack Modifier: your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier

Spellcasting.Ritual Casting: You can cast a cleric spell as a ritual if that spell has the ritual tag and you have the spell prepared.
Spellcasting.Spellcasting Focus: You can use a holy symbol as a spellcasting focus for your cleric spells.

Divine Domain.Description: At 1st level, you choose a domain shaped by your choice of Deity and the gifts they grant you. Your choice grants you domain spells and other features at 1st level, and additional benefits at 6th, 8th, and 17th levels.

Channel Divinity.Description: At 2nd level, you gain the ability to channel divine energy directly from your deity, using that energy to fuel magical effects.

Channel Divinity Effects.Turn Undead: As an action, you present your holy symbol and speak a prayer censuring the undead. Each undead within 30 feet must make a Wisdom saving throw. If it fails, it is turned for 1 minute or until it takes damage.

Channel Divinity.Harness Divine Power (Optional): At 2nd level, you can expend a use of your Channel Divinity to regain one expended spell slot. The number of uses increases at higher levels.

Ability Score Improvement.Description: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or increase two ability scores of your choice by 1.

Class Features.Cantrip Versatility (Optional): Whenever you reach a level in this class that grants the Ability Score Improvement feature, you can replace one cantrip you learned from this class's Spellcasting feature with another cantrip from the cleric spell list.

Destroy Undead.Description: Starting at 5th level, when an undead fails its saving throw against your Turn Undead feature, the creature is instantly destroyed if its challenge rating is at or below a certain threshold.

Class Features.Blessed Strikes (Optional): When you reach 8th level, you are blessed with divine might in battle. When a creature takes damage from one of your cantrips or weapon attacks, you can deal 1d8 radiant damage to that creature. You can use this feature once per turn.

Divine Intervention.Description: Beginning at 10th level, you can call on your deity to intervene on your behalf. Describe the assistance you seek and roll percentile dice. If you roll a number equal to or lower than your cleric level, your deity intervenes. At 20th level, your call for intervention succeeds automatically.
